Dear Ms. Anderton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/4/23, staff member pushed youth multiple times. When
youth pushed back, staff member pushed youth to the ground.
Youth has soreness around her collar bone.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Supervisor was interviewed via phone on
11/6/23. Supervisor reported she was the on-call Supervisor on
11/4/23 and was called into work because an employee did not
show up to work/called in. Supervisor reported prior to coming into
work on 11/4/23, she received a phone call from Staff 2 stating
Youth A was outside and someone needed to come into work
because Staff 1 needed to leave since her shift was over.
Supervisor told Staff 2 to call the other home for support. Then
Staff 1 called Supervisor and said her ride was there and she
needed to leave. Supervisor reported she told Staff 1 she needed
to stay until someone could relieve her. Supervisor reported
neither Staff 1 nor Staff 2 told her what happened prior to Youth A
going outside. Supervisor reported soon after she arrived at the
home, Youth A was upset and told Supervisor she needed to fire
someone. Youth A told Supervisor Staff 1 pushed her to the
ground, and then followed her outside and was threatening to
“punch her” and “smash her face in”. Youth A told Supervisor Staff
1 also called her “an ugly rat” and said, “that’s why no one likes
you”. Supervisor reported she reviewed video footage and
confirmed Staff 1 pushed Youth A multiple times, Youth A was
pushed to the floor, and Staff 1 followed Youth A out of the home.
Supervisor reported Youth A wrote a statement of what happened,
and it was given to Program Manager.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 11/8/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported when Youth A hisses, it’s typically a sign she is going to
be assaultive or increase her behaviors. CA reported Staff 1 is on
leave pending further investigation. CA reported when Program
Manager told Staff 1 she was on leave until further notice, Staff 1
sent Program Manager a text message stating “If [Youth A] says I
2

hit her, please tell me she will be examined head to toe” and
another message stating she “didn’t push or restrain [Youth A] in
the Commons”. CA reported Staff 1 and/or Staff 2 did not submit
an incident report regarding the situation.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/8/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported right
before 8:00 AM on 11/4/23, Youth A woke up and came out of her
room and into the milieu where Staff 1 and Staff 2 were. Staff 1
reported Youth A went into the kitchen and yelled she was hungry
and wanted French toast, but there was not enough French toast
for her, so she became upset and began screaming. Staff 1
reported she was in the milieu when Staff 2 was trying to help
Youth A in the kitchen. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 walked out of the
kitchen and into the staff bathroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A tried
to follow Staff 2 and was pulling the door, but she couldn’t get it
open. Youth A then turned around and threw the staff clipboard
onto the floor. Staff 1 reported she got up, went in front of Youth A
and said, “No, not today”. Staff 1 reported Youth A began hissing
at her and made a move like she was going to spit, so Staff 1 put
her arms up to block getting spit on. Staff 1 reported Youth A then
just dropped to the floor. Staff 1 reported her hands never
physically touched Youth A in any way and Youth A never touched
Staff 1 in any way. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 did not say
anything to Youth A after she fell to the floor. Staff 1 reported she
grabbed her belongings and put them in the staff bathroom so
Youth A could not throw them. Staff 1 reported Youth A was on
the floor crying, then got off the floor, put on her shoes and went
out the first door, but then held the second door open as if she
was waiting for someone to follow her. Staff 1 reported she
followed Youth A out the first door, and then Youth A ran outside,
so Staff 1 grabbed the trash and followed Youth A outside. Staff 1
reported Youth A went to Renucci house, so she followed her and
signaled to Staff 3 not to let Youth A in the home. Staff 1 reported
she was trying to encourage Youth A to get away from the home
as she could see another youth sleeping on the couch in the
milieu and didn’t want them to wake up. Staff 1 reported Youth A
said, “I’m going to sue you. I’m going to get you fired” and then ran
back towards McCullough house. Staff 1 reported as she was
following Youth A, she called Staff 2 and then called Supervisor 1
for support. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to lose momentum on
the path between Ceblek and Ellenbaus houses, so when they
reached the bridge, Staff 1 said “You can’t attack staff just
because you didn’t get what you wanted for breakfast. That’s
bullying”. Staff 1 reported Youth A responded, “I hate you”, and
proceeded to run up the stairs towards the Commons, so Staff 1
3

followed her. Staff 1 reported she didn’t want Youth A to make it to
the street because then she would have to restrain her for her
safety, and Staff 1 didn’t feel she could adequately restrain Youth
A by herself. Staff 1 reported she told Youth A, “You can’t keep
acting like this. You’re going to push people away that really care
about you” and Youth A responded “Shut up. I hate you”. Staff 1
reported they made it to the top of the stairs in front of the
Commons when Staff 3 pulled up in the van. Staff 1 reported
Youth A got in the van and Staff 3 drove her back to McCullough
house. Staff 1 reported she decided to walk back and when she
got there, Staff 3 was still sitting in the van talking to Youth A. Staff
1 reported she left after she gathered her belongings. Staff 1
reported she never called Youth A any names or threatened to
punch her when they were outside. MDHHS Worker, Chief
Administrator and Consultant watched the video footage with Staff
1. Staff 1’s response to watching the video footage was “After
putting my arms up to block [Youth A]’s spitting, it’s all a blur. I
don’t remember pushing her” and “It hurts my heart to see the
video. I don’t even remember any of that happening”.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/8/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A
went to the kitchen to look for something to eat, but she couldn’t
find anything she wanted, so Staff 2 went to the kitchen to help
her. Staff 2 reported there weren’t enough French toast sticks, so
Youth A became angry and started screaming. Staff 2 reported
she walked away and was ignoring Youth A’s behavior because
that’s what they’ve been instructed to do. Staff 2 reported she
went to the staff bathroom to get the key to the medication room
so she could pass medications. Staff 2 reported Youth A tried to
get in while she was in there, but Staff 2 had shut the door and it
was locked. Staff 2 reported she heard Youth A throw the staff
clipboard on the floor in the hallway, so she came out of the
bathroom and saw Staff 1 standing in the middle of the hallway.
Staff 2 reported Youth A ran towards Staff 1 and pushed her. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 put her arms up to stop Youth A from pushing
her and pushed back a bit. Staff 2 reported Youth A screamed
“You bitch!” and charged at Staff 1 again. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
put her arms up again to block Youth A and it looked like they
tussled a bit while they were both standing and then Youth A fell
to the floor. Staff 2 reported she couldn’t’ see everything that
occurred because she was behind Staff 1. Staff 2 reported she felt
Staff 1 might have pushed Youth A “a little bit” when her arms
were blocking Youth A, but it wasn’t much. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
never grabbed Youth A and pushed her or pushed her to the floor.
Staff 2 reported all Staff 1 did was try to block Youth A from
4

pushing her. Staff 2 reported after Youth A fell on the floor, she
went into the medication room to get medications to pass. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 knocked on the door and told Staff 2 to call
someone because Youth A ran out of the house. Staff 2 reported
she stayed in the house with Youth B while Staff 1 went outside
and followed Youth A. Staff 2 reported she called Supervisor for
support and to notify her Youth A went AWOL and Staff 1 was
following her. MDHHS Worker, Chief Administrator and Consultant
watched the video footage with Staff 2. Staff 2 reported after
watching the video, she couldn’t tell if Youth A pushed Staff 1 first
or not. Staff 2 reported she felt Staff 1 was trying to keep Youth A
from going down Youth B’s hallway. Staff 2 reported she never felt
the need to intervene because, from her angle, she couldn’t see
Staff 1 push Youth A like it showed in the video footage. Staff 2
reported she was only able to see the back of Staff 1, and she’s
just used to Youth A being dramatic. Staff 2 reported she didn’t
complete an incident report regarding the situation and didn’t tell
Supervisor anything about what happened over the phone when
she called her for support.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at a different facility on
11/21/23. Youth A reported she was in the milieu and said she
was hungry. Youth A reported she went to the kitchen and looked
in the refrigerator, but there was no food she wanted. Youth A
reported she walked out of the kitchen to check the time on the
phone on the desk/counter located right before walking down a
hallway of bedrooms. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A
once and Youth A backed up. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed her
a second time, which caused Youth A to fall on her back, and it
hurt. Youth A reported Staff 2 was down the hallway and didn’t get
involved because she wasn’t close enough to do anything. Youth
A reported she was crying and ran out of the house to Renucci
house to get away from Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 followed
her to Renucci and told Youth A she wanted to punch her three
times while they were outside. Youth A reported she ran up the
stairs towards the Commons. Youth A reported when Staff 1 got to
the Commons, Staff 1 told Youth A she wanted to smash Youth
A’s face into the pavement. Youth A reported Staff 3 arrived
outside of the Commons with the van, picked Youth A up, and
they went back to the house.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 11/4/23 was reviewed. Youth A is standing in
the kitchen looking around and yells “I’m hungry”. Staff 2 goes into
the kitchen with Youth A and looks in the freezer with her. Staff 2
then walks out of the kitchen and around the corner. Youth A
5

stands in the kitchen and yells “I’m hungry” again. Staff 2 walks
down the hallway (away from Youth A). Youth A follows Staff 2,
takes a few steps down the hallway, pulls on a door, and then
walks back. Youth A shoves a staff notebook/clipboard off the
counter onto the floor. Staff 1 walks out of the milieu, past Youth A
and into the hallway to pick up the notebook/clipboard. As she
walks past Youth A, she says “it’s too early for this bullshit”, and
then Youth A hisses at Staff 1. Staff 2 exits the staff bathroom.
Staff 1 turns around and faces Youth A and shakes her head.
Then Youth A and Staff 1 take a couple steps towards each other.
Staff 1 puts both hands out and pushes Youth A backwards twice
and says “[Youth A] …listen…I’m not one of them”. Youth A
stumbles but catches herself on the dining room chair. Youth A
turns around and screams “Bitch!” and runs at Staff 1. Youth A
uses the side of her body to push up against Staff 1 and Staff 1
holds out her hands to try and block Youth A. Staff 1 pushes
Youth A once. Then, Staff 1 begins walking towards Youth A while
pushing her on her upper chest, which causes Youth A to fall to
the ground. Staff 1 still has her hands on Youth A as she falls.
Youth A remains on the floor in the fetal position crying and
screaming. Staff 1 stands over her and says “Not today! Don’t
start that today. Do not start”. Staff 2 remains in the hallway
watching the entire incident, but due to the camera angles, it’s
unclear what she saw. Staff 1 turns around, walks back down the
hall by Staff 2 and Staff 2 picks up the clipboard on the floor.
Youth A remains crying and screaming on the floor. Staff 1 walks
into the dining room, steps over Youth A, and keeps walking.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Report dated 11/4/23 authored by Supervisor was
consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Written statement authored by Youth A was mostly
consistent with Youth A’s interview. The only difference is
in the written statement, Youth A states after Staff 1 pushed
her to the floor, Staff 1 pulled out some of her hair and
scratched her. Youth A notes Staff 1 called her an “ugly
rat”.
• D.A. Blodget St. John’s Behavior Management Policy (rev.
1/11/22) states when a youth is in crisis and engaging in
behaviors presenting a danger to themselves or others,
diversion and de-escalation techniques are the approaches
staff will respond with. St. John’s prohibits verbal or
physical abuse, threats, or derogatory remarks, any kind of
6

punishment inflicted on the body including physical force,
bullying activities, or physical cruelty.
• Staff 1 had no prior disciplinary records in her employee
file. As a result of this investigation, Staff 1 was terminated
effective 12/1/23. Staff 1 received Aegis training on 4/5/23
and 4/20/23. Staff 1 received BBI Module 2: Preventing
Violence, Trauma, and the use of Seclusion and Restraint
on 5/22/23. Staff 1 received Crisis Intervention for
Individuals with IDD training on 10/11/23.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary action in her
employee file. Staff 2 received Aegis training on 11/23/22
and 4/20/23. Staff 2 received BBI Module 2: Preventing
Violence, Trauma, and the use of Seclusion and Restraint
on 5/25/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and video footage reviewed, this
violation is established as Staff 1 pushed Youth A multiple times,
including pushing her to the ground. In addition, on 11/30/23,
MDHHS Worker reported there was a preponderance of evidence
which resulted in a confirmed case for Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
December 1, 2023
